text:
The image shows the WILD CAT
robot, a four-legged research robot developed by Boston Dynamics. It was designed to run fast on various types of terrain.

Boston Dynamic just unveiled their newest Atlas robot. This is not a render. Oh my god

It's giving "call an ambulance... but not for me"


https://
youtu.be/29ECwExc-_M?si
=4Sk3KycwS3fp9kbd
…

Boston Dynamics was running 10months ago. Everyone else is just playing ketchup

But what’s impressive is how fast the gap between human and robotic movement is closing. Irreversible so too. 

The high speed tsunami is coming

Wow, this is the „feel the AGI“- Moment for robotics for me.

Boston dynamics humanoid robots movement looks so clean it’s incredible.

The robot can walk, run, crawl and so much more. I never have thought to see something like this already this year.

I honestly can’t imagine

Boston Dynamics Exoskeleton: 24-DoF #Robotic Arms with 200-Pound Lifting Power
via 
@Rainmaker1973

  
#ArtificialIntelligence #Innovation #Technology #Engineering

Boston Dynamics is mass producing humanoid robots.

Hyundai's backing them, putting them against Tesla and Figure.

But will these stay flashy demos, or actually start showing up at work?

A disturbing new art installation at Art Basel in Miami Beach by renowned digital artist Beeple has everyone talking. 
 
The new installation, "Regular Animals," features Boston Dynamics-style robots wearing hyper-realistic masks of tech billionaires Jeff Bezos, Elon Musk, and
When you think of robots, do Boston Dynamics or Japan come to mind? You're mistaken!….

This section showcases the T800’s application potential, such as in heavy industry and manufacturing. It uses three-fingered hands.

Boston Dynamics’ Atlas also uses three-fingered hands.

My childhood dream just came true.

Since middle school I’ve been obsessed with Boston Dynamics, watching every single demo on youtube.

Today I had the incredible chance to visit their HQ with 
@Karim_RC
